00051 /**
00052  * @file gateway.h
00053  * @date 2009/05/01 7:07
00054  * @author Sergio Montenegro
00055  *
00056  * Copyright 2009 DLR
00057  *
00058  * @brief subscribers as gateway
00059  *

00062 /**
00063  * A gateway is a link from the local middleware to an external network.
00064  * A single middleware may have many gateways, each connecting to one different external link.
00065  * To send messages, a Gateway works like a normal subscriber to read data from the middleware topics,
00066  * but it can respond to more than one topic.
00067  * Messages received from the external link will be distributed in the
00068  * loccal middleware using the same mechaninsm like normal topics.
00069  *
00070  * To read from the network link, the gateway implements a thread
00071  * which may poll the link or may be reactivated by interrupts from the link.
00072  *
00073  * Some intelligent networks may deliver a list of topics which are expected
00074  * externally. To access other networks, the user has to define which
00075  * topics shall be forwarded (or forward all, but may be inefficient TODO OFr Explain why!).
00076  *
00077  */
00078 
00079 struct SeenNode {
00080     int32_t  nodeID;
00081     uint32_t sequenceCounter;
00082     int64_t  lastMsgTime;
00083 };
00084 
00085 
00086 class Gateway : public Subscriber, public Thread {
00087 
00088 private:
00089     Putter nopPutter; ///< inherited from parent but never used, only as placeholder
00090     Semaphore networkOutProtector;
00091     NetworkMessage networkOutMessage; // protected with semaphore
00092     NetworkMessage networkInMessage;
00093 
00094     /**
00095      * List of topics, which shall be forwarded to the external network.
00096      * For simple networks this could be a constant list.
00097      * For intelligent networks (e.g. using UDP-networks) this list can be provided
00098      * by the networks using topic-id 0.
00099      */
00100     TopicListReport externalsubscribers;
00101 
00102     /** If set true, forces me to forward ALL messages, otherwise only for topics listed */
00103     bool forwardAll;
00104 
00105     /** Hardware abstraction to access the link interface to the network */
00106     Linkinterface* linkinterface;
00107     long linkIdentifier;
00108 
00109     bool getTopicsToForwardFromOutside;
00110 
00111 
00112     /** Transfer messages from the local network to the external network.
00113      * @param[out] topicId ID of sending topic
00114      * @param[out] len length of message to send (size of topic type)
00115      * @param[out] data pointer to data field (type) of message
00116      * @return number of receivers message is sent to, always 1
00117      */
00118     virtual long put(const long topicId, const long len, const void* data, const NetMsgInfo& netMsgInfo);
00119 
00120     void AnalyseAndDistributeMessagesFromNetwork();
00121 
00122     static SeenNode seenNodes[MAX_NUMBER_OF_NODES];
00123     static int32_t numberOfNodes;
00124     static Semaphore seenNodesProtector;
00125 
00126     static bool messageSeen(NetworkMessage& msg);
00127 
00128 public:
00129 
00130     /* From sublcases */
00131     void run();
00132 
00133 
00134     /** At creation time a connection to the corresponding topic
00135      * and putter (receiver) has to be done.
00136      * Subscriber may be "Normal" message receiver or may be gateways.
00137      * Gateways are interfaces to other memory spaces and nodes, example
00138      * going through a network. Gateways just forward messages to other nodes.
00139      *
00140      * The param linkinterface is an object which shall be used to
00141      * access the hardware of the link interface to the network.
00142      * @param linkinterface_ instance of linking interface to either UDP or UART
00143      * @param forwardall_ flag whether to send messages for all or only selected topics
00144      * @param enable flag whether this gateway should send localy published topics to the network, disable if using routers to do this
00145      */
00146     Gateway(Linkinterface* linkinterface_, bool forwardall_ = false,bool enable_ = true);
00147 
00148     /**
00149       *Send out msg over this Gateways LinkInterface.
00150       *Send Is used by the Gateway itsself and may be used by external modules like Routers.
00151       */
00152     void sendNetworkMessage(NetworkMessage& msg);
00153 
00154 
00155     bool shouldTopicForwarded(long topicId) { return forwardAll ? true : externalsubscribers.find(topicId);}
00156     /**
00157      * For Simple networks, the list of topics which shall be forwarded
00158      * to the network has to be known in the local node. This
00159      * list has to be passed to the gateway using setTopicsToForward(...)
00160      * Intelligent networks (for example the implementation using UDP)
00161      * the network provides this list and the receiver thread will
00162      * call this method for arrived messages with topic 0 (list report).
00163      */
00164 
00165     void setTopicsToForward(void* topicList);
00166     void addTopicsToForward(void* topicList);
00167     void addTopicsToForward(TopicInterface* topicId1,TopicInterface* topicId2=0,TopicInterface* topicId3=0,TopicInterface* topicId4=0);
00168     void resetTopicsToForward();
00169 
00170 
00171     TopicListReport* getTopicsToForward() { return &externalsubscribers;}
00172 
00173     /**
00174      * In worst case you may forward all topics. Say true/false.
00175      * If you can not write to the topic list with setTopicsToForwarded
00176      * then you might use this by triggering the flag.
00177      */
00178     void setForwardAllTopics(bool forwardall = true);
00179 
00180     long getLinkIdentifier() {return linkinterface->getLinkdentifier();}
00181 
00182 };
00183 
00184 void prepareNetworkMessage(NetworkMessage& netMsg, const long topicId,const void* data, int len);
